title: This is called a real zombie movie
review: I would say this is a perfect package to deliver a real entertainment. It has drama,emotion,thrill,horror everything , which makes it a real gem. Hollywood should learn from this. I have watched various Hollywood zombie flicks and every movie has the same thing, people are running and zombies are behind them. But this movie gave it a completely new thought and it tells how zombie movie can be made in an awesome way. Everyone in the movie has acted well, specially that little girl.There are few scenes that will make you laugh. So it has comedy too. In past few days, i have watched few Korean movies that changed my thinking about Hollywood. There are other cinemas that can make movies better than the Hollywood.

title: Bullet Train Busan.
review: Talking to a fellow IMDber about what his top film of 2016 was,I got told about a tantalising Korean Horror epic that he had seen at a film festival. Deciding to hold a 2016 Horror double bill viewing this weekend (with the other being the gritty Brit zombie title The Girl with All the Gifts) I booked a ticket for the Busan train.The plot:Putting all his attention on work, Seok-Woo barely sees his daughter Su-an.Sick of hardly seeing her dad,Su-an demands Seok-Woo to take her to Busan,so that Su-an can spend her birthday with her mum/his ex- wife. Taking it on the chin,Seok-Woo books the tickets for him and his daughter. Just before the train departs,a convulsing women jumps on the train.Noticing a large bite mark,Seok-Woo,Su-an soon find their destination to change from Busan to a zombie apocalypse.View on the film:Spending (most) of a two hour running time on a train,writer/director Sang-ho Yeon turns down a comfy seat to lay the track for a white-knuckle ride. Drawn away from Anima for his live action debut,Yeon & cinematographer Hyung-deok Lee brilliantly close the passengers to the chaos on board with ultra-stylish claustrophobic shots,which look from above at the limited room the passengers have for zombie-free air. Mounting up the zombies,Yeon brilliantly chews practical,in-camera effects with CGI shrieks,howling from Yeon keeping the gore to a minimum,to instead carve out an anxiety-drench Horror atmosphere,spun from the disturbing fast/slow spider-like movement of the undead. Watching the world die out as they drive by,the screenplay by Yeon eats up spectacular horror set-pieces with precisely hit personal human tragedy. Taking pit stops on the way to the poetic final destination,Yeon rolls the zombies in with piles of them darting all over the empty stations,with the unlucky pick-ups the train makes leading to some tasty shocks. Looking in at every carriage,Yeon cleverly uses the sweet drama between Seok Woo and Soo-an (played by the fantastic Yoo Gong and Soo-an Kim) as a foundation to keeping a close watch at how everyone on the other carriages fight to keep the zombie train on track.

title: Excellent!
review: Truly the best zombie movie i have seen so far. its like game of thrones but a talented guy wrote it instead of that miserable lard. i cant even being to describe it, the movie is perfectly paced and highly grounded in reality, or at least as much as is possible with these kinds of movies.it holds true emotion and family bonds, its truly a great movie. Giving a perfect 10 even though the movie does take some liberties to insert some suspense. Definitely highly recommend watching this movie.the child actor also gave a very good performance, never expected this from Korea.

title: Amazing!
review: Just amazing!! If you are a big fan of zombie movies, you are going to enjoy this. Since the 90's that i hadn't watched something like this. Great characters, intense, funny and with a lot of surprises. The movie breaks the typical script, off course that it has the typical clichés of the zombie movies but its shown in a different way. There are many situations that you never expect. The characters are natural, indeed you can feel close to them( that's a good thing when you are watching a movie), and its not usual in this kind of films. Also has the "corean drama" included but in a fun way (just my perception). I was surprised, and when a movie surprise you, you know that they did good their job. :)

title: Awesome with Heartbreaking Ending
review: This is one spectacular zombie movie. The acting of all the actors are superb. No cheap jump scares, only genuine and sheer thrills and tensions from most part of the movie. The antagonist in this movie got what he deserved, which was very satisfying to our part as audiences. I was not sure about the little girl's acting skill, because she was like a robot at first half of the movie. But everything was revealed at the end of the movie. And it was really great. It was really heartbreaking when the main actor got bitten at the end. My only regret is that why didn't he use his shoe to gag the old man's mouth, so that he won't be able to bite? Were he to do that, he would still be alive with his daughter and the pregnant lady. Not turned into one of them and threw himself off the train. I cried like a baby when the little girl was crying, refusing to let go of her Dad. It was so sad. Why did they make the main character dead? I think that sucks BIG TIME! And that's the only reason why I didn't give this movie a 10 out of 10.

title: Train to Busan is better than all the resident movies combined!
review: this is my first review in IMDb. had to write a review, this movie is so good.Train to Busan is better than all the resident movies combined! its one of the best zombie survival horror movie in years, if not the best... wow i'm so blown away. its a rare movie where you actually care about the characters. and the zombies are so so fast. world war Z fast, not these dumb zombie in resident evil. if u love zombie movies, go watch it!! it doesn't matter if this is a Korean movie, this is a freaking awesome movie.this movie gives shows how people react to world ending crisis, how the psyche works, i enjoyed it so muchi give this movie a 9.5/10

title: One of the better zombie movies
review: Second Korean movie that I watched this week and again it won me over. For a zombie movie, that has been done over and over again, this one is much better then most of the other zombie movies. With zombie movies you always get the same story with the same slow pasting zombies. In Busanhaeng though the zombies could compete with Usain Bolt over the 100 meters. They are fast and extremely aggressive. And that's only a positive thing for the suspense in a zombie movie. So it's absolutely not like in The Walking Dead where there they are literally just walking and a grandmother with a wooden leg could outrun them. I can't remember any name of the actors nor understand a word of what they saying but I have to admit that there are pretty good actors in Korea. Overall I would give this movie a seven star rating but as a movie in the zombie genre it deserves an eight because it's way better then other zombie movies. Great acting, a good story, fast aggressive and bloody action, you won't get bored for a second.

title: This is how you make a zombie movie.
review: Hollywood will throw millions at special effects and give you an endless gorefest, and still fail to deliver a truly gripping zombie movie. Train to Busan is a zombie movie that delivers on all levels.First off, the zombies are excellent. No super over the top effects, just some simple veiny makeup and contacts, and you have clear infected and the actors movements just sell the rest. Keep your massively overpriced Hollywood zombies that look like they belong in a movie and enjoy a true horde of undead that actually make you feel like there's no way to survive.Secondly, the movie has heart. It has believable characters that show the range of reactions you would find in real people. There's the self made heroes, the reluctant heroes, the people just trying to survive, the frightened mobs, and of course, the jackasses that will throw anyone they can under the bus (or zombie) in order to try and keep themselves safe. Add to that the truly emotional moments in the film. There are scenes that are simply emotionally painful to watch because of how well done and authentic they come across. None of that Hollywood cheese that tries to slap you in the face with a cardboard emotional scene and tells you to feel sad. This movie shows you how real people react and the actors make you feel like you're the one feeling the feels.For people who want a great zombie movie, this is one you can't miss. It also wins top points with those looking for great survival stories, or the drama of dealing with everything going wrong and trying to find some ray of hope. This should be the blueprint that all movies should use to know how to make a quality film.

title: One of the best zombie movies ever seen
review: Great movie , and just loved it . But i am a bit surprised that not a single bullet of fire took place to kill a zombie. The pregnant girl was really really cute. Don't know what her actual name is. But just liked her .Her fighting husband and the little girl"s father and herself too . Good movie really to watch . It was a bit surprising about the late inter fair of the defense .But finally they protected the people.The most tragic scene was the father of the little girl"s death .The funny thing about the zombies was their senses were weak . They cant even see in darkness too . After all it was a good experience watching it on my laptop, smoking a cigarette while lights were off .

title: Not scary or gory. Tedious and boring. The ending sucks.
review: Some of the characters' behaviours in the movie are laughable. For example, the first time the passengers got out of the train only to find the station infested with zombies. What was their reaction? Run back and open the door to a car already full of zombies! Smart move, people!For another example, a bunch of survivors in car #15 refused to open the door for another group of survivors, because some guy feared the other group might be infected. Actually, one easy solution would be for survivors in car #15 to move to another car, for instance, car #16 and let those people have #15. Car #15 was not the only safe place. But... They were too dumb to make room, those idiots.The beggar character's heroic move at the climax makes no sense. He had always been portrayed as cowardly. Therefore, the sudden 180 degrees change is not convincing at all.Let's not forget the laughable ending. The little girl suddenly felt like singing after the disaster? Yeah, very interesting. It would have been so much better if the soldiers had killed both the pregnant woman and the girl. That kind of dark ending would have made an impact. The current one in the movie is ridiculous.The plot was predictable. You could always guess who was going to die next. The movie is not even scary, and the amount of gore is atrociously little.I guess the only good thing is the opening scene where a deer became a zombie deer. That was interesting enough.

title: Very little to complain about
review: It's a great Zombie movie that focuses more emphasis on the people rather than the fact that Zombies are running around. Unlike the majority of movies in this genre. Character development is right on the money even for those who only get a short amount of time or lines on screen. I have a few bones to pick with the way things were carried out on 2 occasions in the movie but to an extent it is part of what makes it great because I'm left thinking backwards about how things could have gone differently only if this happened. Then I think further back and say the same thing. It's a must watch. You will be invested in the characters completely.

title: The best Zombie Movie in 2016
review: I heard about this movie from a friend who told me about and said is very good. This is perhaps the first Korean Zombie movie, the whole movie except the first 15 minutes is so action pack and make you edge of your seat. Like most zombie movie, they don't really explain the origin of outbreak and the outbreak was happens so quick, I think this outbreak is the quickest I ever see in any TV show or movie. If you love zombie movie and show, this won't be disappoint to you as well. This movie more realistic show what would human behave and you will see worst of their form in this movie and also some of best form. This is good balance intake.

title: It wasn't flawless but still thoroughly enjoyable
review: Overall, the plot and development of the story were engaging throughout. There were only a few forgivable occasions when the verisimilitude and consistency of dialogue, characters, and story were waning. To be completely fair, I really enjoyed the suspense kept throughout the entire film. The cinematography and editing captured the chaos of events really well and the deaths were neither predictable nor overdone. In the end, the protagonist reconciles his prior shortcomings and the film ends full circle. My only grief is that I wish they would have saved more characters, allowing each group to find their own way out the train station after the separation (which would have been more realistic) instead of killing everyone immediately and leaving just the daughter and girlfriend as the focal point (which is the standard but so very typical.) I also wish the writers and director would have explored the night-blindness of the monsters in an open urban setting (imagine if you had discovered that these monsters were absolutely blinded in darkness; why would you not have shared this with everyone and made your escape plans to accommodate that huge advantage?) There was huge potential with that, so I am slightly disappointed it wasn't utilized more significantly. But, in total, I think the film managed a 7/10.On a side note, I'm expecting some of these negative reviews are biased against the film for being of Korean origin. Also, the subtitles can suck.

title: Amazing film, one of the best horror films of 2016
review: I came across this by accident, and I am so glad I did. This is by far one of the best horror films of 2016. Set on a high speed train traveling through South Korea on just another day, the passengers are trapped inside a fast paced metal coffin of death, along with victims from a virus outbreak. It doesn't take long until the the situation is out of control and people are forced to defend themselves against certain death any way they can. The film is a road-map into the emotions of humans in a crisis. Ans we get to watch in horror as fear and panic claims just as many lives as the infected. We follow a random selection of passengers, but we closely follow the divorced father who has brought his young daughter on the train to visit her mother on her birthday. That movement from train-car to train-car could be a step towards safety just as death, and all the traits that make up who you are could be what saves you or lead to your demise.Amazing performances from the entire cast. Especially from young Soo-an Kim. Cinematography is great and some scenes are nothing short of astonishing. A film that constantly have your heart pounding and doesn't leave you unmoved. A must see for the horror fan.

title: One of the greatest horror movies -- I was shocked it was so amazing.
review: Tonight, I was looking for a movie to watch on my InfinityTV.I have always liked horror movies and I came across "Train to Busan" (2016).That's right--a modern one for a change.This is a Korean movie, shot in Korea. I watched it in English subtitles.This is a horror movie with a zombie theme. I know that makes it sound very cheesy but the write-up on it made it sound like it might be different.It was. That is an understatement.This was a beautiful film. I cried at three points. There is a strong love story and life lessons about bravery/ethics for others.It has to be one of the greatest horror films I have ever seen.I will never forget it.That's right--a horror zombie foreign film in English subtitles. It was unbelievably good. The zombies were overshadowed by the stories and the rest of the movie.If you are able to come across it, I extremely highly recommend it.

title: Pretty awesome
review: I was kind of skeptical at first about this movie, but decided to give it a go and watch it. That was not a waste of time.Being a fan of The walking dead, World War Z, 28 days later and so on, this will be a definite addition to the list of great zombie movies.The youngest actress is captivating with her emotions,great talent. Good plot,great cast, characters you get to love and feel sad about, even shed a few tears too!Overall very impressed, now I am in a mood to look for more Korean movies to watch!
